name: Jollof Rice
description: A popular West African dish made with rice, tomatoes, onions, and spices. Often served with chicken, beef, or fish.

name: Pounded Yam & Egusi Soup
description: A classic Nigerian dish with smooth pounded yam served with a thick, savory soup made from ground melon seeds and leafy vegetables.

name: Suya
description: A spicy meat skewer which is a popular street food in Nigeria. Typically made from beef or chicken.

name: Fried Rice
description: A staple Nigerian dish similar to Jollof rice, but cooked with mixed vegetables, liver, and shrimp.

name: Moi Moi
description: A Nigerian steamed bean pudding made from peeled beans, onions, and a blend of spices.

name: Akara
description: Deep-fried bean cakes made from a mixture of peeled beans, onions, and spices. Often served with pap.

name: Efo Riro
description: A rich and hearty vegetable soup made with spinach and assorted meats, often eaten with fufu or pounded yam.

name: Ogbono Soup
description: A popular Nigerian soup made with ground ogbono seeds, which give the soup its thick, stretchy texture.

name: Boli (Roasted Plantain)
description: A delicious street food of roasted plantains often served with groundnut or pepper sauce.

name: Pepper Soup
description: A spicy broth-based dish made with assorted meat or fish and a blend of hot spices.

name: Ofada Rice & Ayamase Sauce
description: A local variety of brown rice served with a spicy green pepper sauce made with assorted meats.

name: Beans & Plantain
description: A hearty meal of stewed beans served with fried ripe plantains. It's a popular comfort food in Nigeria.

name: Afang Soup
description: A nutritious soup made with Afang leaves, waterleaf, and a variety of meats and fish. Usually served with fufu.

name: Tuwo Shinkafa & Miyan Kuka
description: A Northern Nigerian dish made from soft rice balls served with a thick, greenish soup made from baobab leaves.

name: Nkwobi
description: A Nigerian delicacy made from cow foot mixed in spicy palm oil paste. Often served with cold drinks.
